trans-unit.source: Authoring Templates with Azure VM Extensions | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Authoring Templates with Azure VM Extensions | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn more about authoring Templates with Extensions
trans-unit.target: Learn more about authoring Templates with Extensions

trans-unit.source: Authoring Azure Resource Manager Templates with VM Extensions.
trans-unit.target: Authoring Azure Resource Manager Templates with VM Extensions.

trans-unit.source: Overview of Azure Resource Manager Templates.
trans-unit.target: Overview of Azure Resource Manager Templates.

trans-unit.source: Azure Resource Manager Template allows you to declaratively specify the Azure IaaS infrastructure in Json language by defining the dependencies between resources.
trans-unit.target: Azure Resource Manager Template allows you to declaratively specify the Azure IaaS infrastructure in Json language by defining the dependencies between resources.

trans-unit.source: For a detailed overview of Azure Resource Manager Templates, please refer to the articles below:
trans-unit.target: For a detailed overview of Azure Resource Manager Templates, please refer to the articles below:

trans-unit.source: Resource Group Overview.
trans-unit.target: Resource Group Overview.

trans-unit.source: Deploying Templates with Azure CLI.
trans-unit.target: Deploying Templates with Azure CLI.

trans-unit.source: Deploying Templates with Azure Powershell.
trans-unit.target: Deploying Templates with Azure Powershell.

trans-unit.source: Sample template snippet for VM Extensions.
trans-unit.target: Sample template snippet for VM Extensions.

trans-unit.source: The template snippet for Deploying extensions looks as following:
trans-unit.target: The template snippet for Deploying extensions looks as following:

trans-unit.source: Identifying the publisher, type and the typeHandlerVersion for any extension.
trans-unit.target: Identifying the publisher, type and the typeHandlerVersion for any extension.

trans-unit.source: Azure VM Extensions are published by Microsoft and trusted 3rd party publishers and each extension is uniquely identified by its publisher,type and the typeHandlerVersion.
trans-unit.target: Azure VM Extensions are published by Microsoft and trusted 3rd party publishers and each extension is uniquely identified by its publisher,type and the typeHandlerVersion.

trans-unit.source: These can be determined as following:
trans-unit.target: These can be determined as following:

trans-unit.source: From Azure PowerShell, run the following Azure PowerShell cmdlet:
trans-unit.target: From Azure PowerShell, run the following Azure PowerShell cmdlet:

trans-unit.source: From Azure CLI, run the following Azure PowerShell cmdlet:
trans-unit.target: From Azure CLI, run the following Azure PowerShell cmdlet:

trans-unit.source: This cmdlet returns the publisher name, extension name and version as following:
trans-unit.target: This cmdlet returns the publisher name, extension name and version as following:

trans-unit.source: These three properties map to "publisher", "type" & "typeHandlerVersion" respectively in the above template snippet.
trans-unit.target: These three properties map to "publisher", "type" & "typeHandlerVersion" respectively in the above template snippet.

trans-unit.source: Note : Its always recommended to use the latest extension version to get the most updated functionality.
trans-unit.target: Note : Its always recommended to use the latest extension version to get the most updated functionality.

trans-unit.source: Identifying the schema for the Extension configuration parameters
trans-unit.target: Identifying the schema for the Extension configuration parameters

trans-unit.source: The next step with authoring extension template is to identify the format for providing configuration parameters.
trans-unit.target: The next step with authoring extension template is to identify the format for providing configuration parameters.

trans-unit.source: Each extension supports its own set of parameters.
trans-unit.target: Each extension supports its own set of parameters.

trans-unit.source: To look at some sample configuration for Windows Extensions, click the documentation [Windows Extensions Samples](virtual-machines-extensions-configuration-samples-windows.md).
trans-unit.target: To look at some sample configuration for Windows Extensions, click the documentation [Windows Extensions Samples](virtual-machines-extensions-configuration-samples-windows.md).

trans-unit.source: To look at some sample configuration for Linux Extensions, click the documentation for [Linux Extensions Samples ](virtual-machines-extensions-configuration-samples-linux.md).
trans-unit.target: To look at some sample configuration for Linux Extensions, click the documentation for [Linux Extensions Samples ](virtual-machines-extensions-configuration-samples-linux.md).

trans-unit.source: Please refer to the following to the VM Templates to get a fully complete Template with VM Extensions.
trans-unit.target: Please refer to the following to the VM Templates to get a fully complete Template with VM Extensions.

trans-unit.source: After authoring the template, you can deploy them using Azure CLI or Azure Powershell.
trans-unit.target: After authoring the template, you can deploy them using Azure CLI or Azure Powershell.
